headline: Easy Bacon and Cheese Quiche
description: This is an easy, cheesy bacon quiche that takes no time to prepare using a frozen deep-dish pie crust, bacon bits, cream, and two types of cheese.

video.name: How to Make Easy Bacon and Cheese Quiche

name: Easy Bacon and Cheese Quiche
recipeIngredient: 1 (9 inch) deep dish frozen pie crust

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C).
Place unthawed pie crust in a pie pan on a baking sheet. Mix bacon, chopped onion, and both cheeses in a medium bowl. Pour this mixture into the crust.
Mix eggs and half and half in a bowl until blended; pour the egg mixture over the cheese mixture.
Bake in preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C) and bake until the top of the quiche begins to turn golden brown, an additional 35 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Made this over the weekend and it turned out great. Omitted onions and parmesan and used a little more Swiss cheese, used real bacon bits and added thawed frozen spinach after wringing it in paper towels to get all the liquid out. So many possibilities for this recipe like chorizo, cheddar and jalapeños or Italian sausage, mozzarella and basil. Thanks for a quick and good basic recipe.

Oh come on - bacon bits? You have to be kidding me. ANYONE can cook bacon and the difference would be enormous. With REAL fresh-baked bacon, this is a great recipe. Did not use Parmesan as it just doesn't fit with a quiche - it's all about the Swiss
One of the best recipes I’ve made on this site. It has wonderful flavor.

Decent recipe. Easy to substitute with whatever you like. Broccoli, mushrooms, peppers, etc. I used shredded Mexican blend cheese. Recommend not using parmesan. Too strong. I used more eggs and less cream and for goodness sake use actual bacon instead of fake bacon bits.
Very easy, everyone who I've served this to loves it.
I made two for work...and they were devoured almost immediately. Incredibly easy to make, and absolutely delicious!

I've made many quiche recipies. Used this to teach my granddaughter how to make quiche. It's such an easy recipe. I make using a scratch dough and using heavy cream a water, 5 eggs, 1/2 tsp baking powder. Saute' my onion first and rimmed crust with tinfoil to avoid over-browning. This is a delectable quiche and you can use many very or cheese substitutes. 5*

I make a lot of quiche in my house, and this is the base recipe. But I have made substantial changes over the years. We are cutting carbs, and I found out you don't need a crust. Swiss cheese will cook into an excellent crust-like base. I usually use ham or bacon, and toss in a lot of veggies to make it healthier. I use onions, tomatoes (especially with bacon) and sweet red peppers normally. I have used cooked chicken on occasion. omitted the meat for a vegetarian meal, used almost any kind of cheese. I usually use 2% milk. Start here and then, if you like, expand to make it your way.
I absolutely love this recipe! Lost mine in my last move and this one is even better! I shared it with a neighbor and she raved about how wonderful it is! The only thing I “added” was spinach!!

Came out perfect!!! It was my first time ever making a quiche, but I can’t see myself using any other recipe. It was so quick and easy. I did however, omit the onions (my kids are not a fan of onions) and I used mozzarella and mild cheddar cheese.
It was great and very easy to make. I use sausage instead of bacon. It was sooooo good. This will be made many more times!
HELLO CHEF ,HERE I am with a great good news for you about the khal.com a cooking land for cooking kings and queens like you.??
I use Swiss and Romano if I don't have mozzarella and I also add spinach and mushrooms if I have them on hand. Can also substitute ham if you want.
Yes added 3 oz of sharp cheddar cheese
We are low carbing so made crust from almond meal. Also used 1/2 cream 1/2 water coz I had no half half. Totally delish! Love quiche. Happy new year 2022!
Made with homemade crust and evaporated skim milk because we didn’t have half n half. Super good!
Easy Pizzy, use real bacon and your favorite cheese and you’ve got a winner!

The recipe is great, but i’ve always added my own kick with mushrooms, spinach, and cheddar cheese. The only thing i’d have to say about the spinach is, if you use fresh spinach, make sure you drain it extremely well! Overall great recipe.
Very easy recipe and it turns out great each time. Seems like it is a great base recipe then you can add whatever you like to it. I have added mushrooms and spinach and it turned out great.
Fast, easy and the family really liked it!
Super easy!

Substituted shredded cheddar cheese for swiss and used shaved parmasan cheese instead of grated. Still turned out great - very easy to assemble and baked to a nice browned topping. Hubby loved it so will use again.

Super simple! Made some changes to suit my family's taste. I buttered the quiche dish and eliminated the pie crust to make it gluten-free and used cheddar cheese. My family loved it and requested it again!

I made two kinds: bacon and cheddar, and ham with two provolone slices cut into pieces. I had to sub half the cream with 2 percent milk, and it still came out delicious! I used a whole sweet onion in it. The latter one I made would benefit from spinach or broccoli cut of tiny into it. The bacon one is winning for today. I will definitely make it again with all milk and see if it makes a lot of difference. I will also cut up the ham to tinier pieces too. Bacon bits make this SO easy to do!
Followed the recipe except used cooked bacon instead of bacon bits and sauted the onion in bacon grease. Turned out perfect! My new base quiche recipe!
Delicious!! I used cheddar instead of Swiss. It was marvelous.
This was an easy and delicious breakfast to make.
Very good! Needs 1/2 salt.

Truly one of the most delicious and easy things that ever came out of my oven. My only additions were a pinch of nutmeg, sauteed the onions and used turkey bacon. I don't know if I can ever make this again since I'm likely to eat the entire quiche by myself. Dangerous and addictive!

Added salt and pepper, otherwise, just as instructed. Great as always.

Thanks
I love this recipe and so does my family. I have made it 3 times so far and have made both ham and bacon versions, with and without the onions. I have added a fifth egg once, otherwise no changes.
Real easy to make! I added spinach, green onion, and pepper jack cheese instead of Parmesan. Delicious!
Super easy and delicious Quiche! I used real bacon instead of bits, and I cooked it a bit longer than the recipe calls for. It was wonderful.

This turned out wonderful and so good. I didn't have bacon bits so just used fried bacon. I did add some salt and pepper to the eggs and I had a few peppers and mushrooms I fried with the bacon. This is a very versatile recipe and this will be my go to for quiche. I had a friend come for lunch and she absolutely loved it. It was even good reheated a couple days later.
Super easy and tastes great. Will try different cheese next time to mix it up.
My friend asked for the recipe! Really simple and tasty. I used Taco cheese which has jalapeño.
All I use is reduced fat Mexican cheese, Parmesan cheese, bacon bits, eggs, half and half, and the frozen pie crust. My husband, 18 month old and friends love it.
Turned out perfectly, family and friends loved it, nothing left on their plates. I added thawed chopped spinach after squeezing as much water out of it as possible.
Super easy and tasty. I added some fresh spinach and used green onions instead of the yellow onion.
I’ve made this twice now and my wife loves it! I used a small bunch of green onions instead and the flavor combination with the cheeses and bacon was really tasty!
I made this with green chilis and cheddar cheese. no bacon. it was amazing. and so easy.
Loved this recipe! Tasted delicious. I did sauté the onions and a handful of spinach leaves before adding to the cheese. My family loved it and was very easy. Thanks for a yummy recipe!
11-1-20 used half green pepper onion mushroom cooked these first then added tomatoe and swiss cheese put in 5 eggs and one cup milk cooked 15 min at 400 then 30 at 350
Yummy and super easy! Pay attention to the reduction in the heat! I missed it at first, but caught it a short while later.
Tastes great! Have used different cheeses and put veggies in. I always make 2 and freeze the left-overs.
This is my new favorite quiche recipe. It even freezes and reheats well.
I used red onion sautéed in butter until softened and golden.
Came out perfect and so easy to do! Delish.

Was looking for an easy and quick quiche and found this one. It came out perfect at settings specified. I was short the Parmesan so I just used the Swiss, threw in a little cooked breakfast sausage. I will be making frequently?...added some pics

Love it! Great basic recipe that you can adjust to fit your taste. I’ve made it quite a few times and used Pillsbury pie crust, 5 eggs, an entire 4.3 oz package of Oscar Meyer Real bacon bits, any cheese I have on hand (it’s been good with Swiss, Cheddar, Italian Blend), added 1/2 cup of green bell peppers. It feeds my family of four for breakfast.

I tried this recipe for my first ever quiche- very delicious!! My family prefers cheddar so I used that in lieu of Swiss. Other than that, I made it exactly as written. Very easy and such a confidence booster, I’ll now be adding this as one of my go-to brunch recipes.
Great recipe
This WAS easy and delicious. My family loved it.
Delicious, I added spinach. I will cook the onions next time before putting them in the quiche.
Kids love this and it is super easy
Easy recipe to make and it's delicious. This is also a great base recipe. I have used a different mix of ingredients, spices, and types of cheese and just kept the same egg/half and half ratio.

I have made this many times now because it IS easy and so delicious. My only change is that I now make it crustless, and I've bumped the eggs up to 5 or 6. (It still fits in a regular 8-inch pan.) Last weekend I found some leftover smoked Gouda in the fridge and used that in place of the shredded Swiss -- decadent!
Subbed Cheddar cheese because I didn't have Swiss on hand. Delicious quiche!
My go-to appetizer

I've made this recipe at least 20 times now and everytime they look for more.
grate the onion for smoother taste.
add extra eggs if you like. I do 6.
Yummy and easy to fix!! Thanks!
Very easy to make and delicious!
YUM! Everyone loved this recipe!

I made this quiche for a gathering and it was simply delish! I made my own pie crust and bacon bites. I just cooked the bacon and then put it in the food processor [you can use a blender also if you don't have a food processor]. I can't say anything bad about this dish! A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!
No changes, it was wonderful! I have definitely made it several times and will continue to do so!
I followed the directions to a tee, it turned out perfect.
Was great! First time ever making a quiche. I used real bacon chopped up instead of imitation/already made. And substituted Swiss for cheddar and mozzarella
We love this recipe and it’s delicious with various cheeses. We just use whatever we have on hand!
very easy to make, added various veggies per my taste.

Made this for a brunch with our Grandson and his new bride. It was a hit and I will make it again, very tastey. Didn't have any half n half, so used whole milk and added 3 more eggs. I made one of the pie crust with spinach and bell peppers. I sautés the onion with garlic as one other suggested. Was too much for one pie crust but not enough for the second, one reason for the 7th egg. Just added a little more milk and another egg.

Very yummy! I used a homemade thawed pie crust. I also sauteed the onion with some yellow peppers in some olive oil before adding.. Next time I'll add some fresh spinach and wilt it and add it to the quiche. My husband and son loved this too!
I will make it again
Love this but I use bacon I cooked. Add some extras that I have on hand.
Great, no changes were made
Moist, delicious, cheesy dish! Never thought I could make it.
It was good. Sauteed onions and a few large mushrooms. Also while bacon was cooking in the oven, I baked the frozen pie crust for 10 min. I don't ever use pre-cooked bacon. Will make this again.
Made it and loved it...didn't have any milk except evaporated, so I used that. Other than that, just like the recipe. Will do it again as everyone loved it!!!

My son and I really like this recipe! I have addedsome things: instead of bacon bits I amke peppered bacon-- takes it to a new level ! Sometimes I add spinach. Either way, very good!

Thank You!
Easy to do...and to add ham, broccoli or other cheeses or veggies...tastes great.

This recipes is good as is, but it's also a good basic recipe to add veggies and small amounts of various meats. After eating a couple of pieces, I decided to freeze the remainder in individual portions...it worked well.
Used only 1/2 cup cream and 25 minutes cooking on lower temp, but it came out great!!!

I have made this several times, comes out really well. It is also a great base to start if you want to change it up with different ingredients. I make them to have on hand for several meals during the week when I am in a rush. Heats up surprisingly well in the microwave

This was delicious! I made it with 1/2 c milk and 1/2c FF half n half. I also used r-f sharp cheddar instead of swiss, garlic powder, onion powder, salt and pepper. We were all delighted and had full bellies!

First time I made quiche. This recipe was very easy and I received compliments from my family. I added a little diced red pepper to this recipe. I also made a vegetarian version using cheddar cheese instead of Swiss. My husband said this is a keeper.

This is an excellent quiche which is quick and easy to prepare. I omit the onion as my husband doesn't like them unless they are fried to almost black! I use fresh parmesan and white cheddar. I have made this quiche using bacon bits and also left over ham and both are delicious. This is my go to recipe for quiche...it is very good.
So easy to make. My husband isn't to crazy about "New Food" as he would say. He really liked this Quiche. I froze the rest using my vacuum sealer so I can enjoy it later down the line.
Quick and easy.I combined it with Quiche Lorraine 1 recipe to make a new recipe to work in with my available ingredients.
Super easy. Super yummy. I used gouda because that was what I had. I did not use onion.

This was an ok recipe. I used real bacon and Monterey Jack cheese but otherwise followed the recipe as written. I thought there were too many eggs in this as I like my quiche more creamy than spongy . It had a good taste but the texture was not what I was looking for. I may try this with less eggs and see how it turns out.
Awesome recipe thank you for all
Taking an hour to cook,that’s a bit to long for breakfast. Over all a great dish.

This was the best quiche I have ever had or made. The guests ate the entire quiche and raved over the creamy quiche. All in all a perfect meal for breakfast lunch or dinner! Served with a salad at lunch or dinner it is wonderful

This was so easy and delicious... Only thing different I did was layer my cheese first then added a little fresh mild salsa mix to my bacon then poured the egg mixture over it. Baked for 30 minutes on 375. Perfect. Now I have a go to dish for school teachers functions. (Btw I also made a sausage one with fresh baby spinach on top)
The Swiss flavor is a bit overpowering. I think next time I’ll use half as much Swiss and try cheddar for the other half. I also added sautéed fresh mushrooms and baby spinach.

This is a good basic recipe and then you can customize it for your taste. I did not have swiss cheese so used a 4 cheese cheddar with some Parmesan mixed in. I also used half of the half and half and the rest I used milk. Whole family enjoyed it!
I used Colby Jack and 8 slices of turkey bacon cut into small pieces and it is wonderful!
I made this Keto by leaving off the crust. The family loved it.
I made this and it was very easy and very delicious! Thanks for sharing! :)
This was a hit at our Father's Day breakfast. Also make a version with frozen chopped spinach (thawed and drained well), Feta cheese instead of swiss and Parmesean.
